          John Glenn, First American to Orbit Earth, Dies at Age 95

          John Glenn, the first American to orbit the Earth and a four-term U.S. senator, died at the age of 95. Mr. Glenn, a former military test pilot, was chosen by NASA in 1959 to become one of America’s first astronauts in the “Mercury Seven” program in an age when astronauts were the ultimate heroes. 143
